ContextLambda.description: A lambda declaration for prompt context in config.

lambda.description:
A lambda declaration is a python expression evaluated within the context of the flow and any provided variables.
If you reference an action's output, it will ensure that action runs before this one.
lambda.markdownDescription:
A lambda declaration is a python expression evaluated within the context of the flow and any provided variables.  
If you reference an action's output, it will ensure that action runs before this one.

Reference variables or action outputs like:

> ```yaml
> lambda: |
> ```
> ```python
>   "My name is " + name + ". The output of action_id is " + action_id.output_name
> ```

You can also use list comprehension and conditionals:

> ```yaml
> lambda: |
> ```
> ```python
>   [item for item in items if item.name != 'foo']
> ```
lambda.title: Lambda

heading.description: The heading for the context element.
heading.markdownDescription:
The heading for the context element.

If `quote_style` is set to `backticks`, the heading will be wrapped in backticks, according to the following jinja template:    

> ~~~jinja
> {{ heading }}
> ```
> {{ value }}
> ```
> ~~~


If `quote_style` is set to `xml`, the heading will be wrapped in XML tags, according to the following jinja template:

> ```jinja
> <{{ heading }}>
> {{ value }}
> </{{ heading }}>
> ```
heading.title: Heading

ContextLambda.title: ContextLambda

ContextLink.description: An input declaration for prompt context in config.

link.description: A link declaration references another action's output, and ensures that action runs before this one.
link.title: Link

heading.description: The heading for the context element.
heading.markdownDescription:
The heading for the context element.

If `quote_style` is set to `backticks`, the heading will be wrapped in backticks, according to the following jinja template:    

> ~~~jinja
> {{ heading }}
> ```
> {{ value }}
> ```
> ~~~


If `quote_style` is set to `xml`, the heading will be wrapped in XML tags, according to the following jinja template:

> ```jinja
> <{{ heading }}>
> {{ value }}
> </{{ heading }}>
> ```
heading.title: Heading

ContextLink.title: ContextLink

ContextTemplate.description: A template string for prompt context in config.

text.description:
A text declaration is a jinja2 template, rendered within the context of the flow and any provided variables.
If you reference an action's output, it will ensure that action runs before this one.

For more information, see the Jinja2 documentation: https://jinja.palletsprojects.com/en/3.0.x/templates/.
text.markdownDescription:
A text declaration is a jinja2 template, rendered within the context of the flow and any provided variables.  
If you reference an action's output, it will ensure that action runs before this one.

Reference variables or action outputs like: 

> ```yaml
> text: |
> ```
> ```jinja
>   Hi {{ name }}, the output of action_id is {{ action_id.output_name }}
> ```

It also supports advanced features such as loops and conditionals:

> ```yaml
> text: |
> ```
> ```jinja
>   {% for item in items -%}
>     {% if item.name != 'foo' -%}
>     {{ item.name }}: {{ item.value }}
>     {% endif %}
>   {% endfor %}
> ```

For more information, see the [Jinja2 documentation](https://jinja.palletsprojects.com/en/3.0.x/templates/).
text.title: Text

heading.description: The heading for the context element.
heading.markdownDescription:
The heading for the context element.

If `quote_style` is set to `backticks`, the heading will be wrapped in backticks, according to the following jinja template:    

> ~~~jinja
> {{ heading }}
> ```
> {{ value }}
> ```
> ~~~


If `quote_style` is set to `xml`, the heading will be wrapped in XML tags, according to the following jinja template:

> ```jinja
> <{{ heading }}>
> {{ value }}
> </{{ heading }}>
> ```
heading.title: Heading

ContextTemplate.title: ContextTemplate

If `quote_style` is set to `xml`, the heading will be wrapped in XML tags, according to the following jinja template:

promptActionInvocation.description:
Prompt the LLM with a message and receive a response.

INPUTS
- model: OptionalModelConfig (optional)
- quote_style: 'backticks' | 'xml' (optional)  
  The quote style to use for the prompt. Defaults to XML-style quotes for Claude models and backticks for others.
- prompt: list[RoleElement | TextElement | ContextVar | ContextLink | ContextTemplate | ContextLambda]

OUTPUTS
- result: str  
  Response given by the LLM
